description: Ultimately from German Alexine, coined by Hans Buchner in 1891 from the Ancient Greek ἀλέξειν (aléxein).

entries.meaning: (biochemistry, dated) A protective substance that exists in the serum or other bodily fluid and is capable of killing microorganisms; complement.
examples: The seed of our destruction will blossom in the desert, the alexin of our cure grows by a mountain rock  […]
